About Me

Back-end

My main focus. I love algorithm & software design. RESTful & secure back-end with authentification and database validations

Front-end

Responsive & animated layouts with performance optimization

API plugin

External communications & data fetching

Self-Taught Survivor

I'm a professional googler, I read error messages and I understand documentations. Yeah you heard me right

Team Buddy

Github team workflow using feature branches & pull requests/code reviews. MVP & agile methodology for projects

Learning & Sharing

My purposes at heart. My best coding experiences are the ones I have with people. I strongly believe in team synergie

Projects

ShareMyHobby

Large Ruby on Rails team project after a 3 months bootcamp at The Hacking Project.

Implementations:

  • CRUD app & Devise API for authentification
  • Git team workflow with pull requests
  • Heroku pipeline: staging & production
  • Full model validations in database
  • Features: chatroom, like, follow, comments & a filtering algorithm based on user preferences

Tic Tac Toe JS

Tic Tac Toe game in vanilla JavaScript

Implementations:

  • Factory Functions & the Module Pattern design patterns for code organization
  • Code encapsulation using closures & ES6 modules
  • Single responsibility principle
  • Animation & Responsive
  • Build tool: webpack with customized configurations

Implementations:

  • Problem solving approach: pen & paper breakdown beforehand (see case study in README)
  • Object oriented design
  • Folder & files architecture: one class per file
  • Namespacing: no global code

Tic Tac Toe Ruby

Tic Tac Toe game with terminal UI in Ruby

Implementations:

  • Optimized performance parallax effect (see case study in README)
  • Flexbox layout and responsiveness
  • Using requestAnimationFrame() API
  • Multiple animations: on hover & on scroll (no use of onScroll event)
  • HTML semantic markup

Secretlab blog webpage

A static webpage replica of Secretlab blog.

Education

Bootcamp

I successfully completed a 3 months bootcamp at The Hacking Project. It significantly boosted my learning curve, and gave me my first opportunity to work on a large team project. Since then, I've continued to learn on my own and deepen the knowledge.

Certifications:
  • Completion Certificate (PDF)
  • Training Certificate (PDF)

Self-teaching

I'm largely self-taught, using online courses and tutorials. I've also completed HTML/CSS and JavaScript tracks of The Odin Project.

Book

I've studied the fascinating book Metaprogramming Ruby 2: Program Like the Ruby Pros, from Paolo Perrotta. I had a lot of insights regarding the beauty behind Rails and I discovered a passion for design patterns in POO languages, especially Ruby.
